channel.title: Auto color picking?
channel.description:
can someone teach me how to use auto color picking in a script?
ive looked in some tuts but cant find it. thanks

item.title: Auto color picking?
item.dc:creator: @Mad_Cow Mad Cow
item.description:
@Mad_Cow wrote:

Try creating a bitmap and keep increasing the tolerance to a certain level till found.

Eg.
[scar]program AutoColour;
var
BlahBlah : Integer;

function FindBlahBlah : Integer;
var
C, TX, TY, Bitmap, Color: Integer;
begin
Bitmap := BitmapFromString(10, 10, ‘523236589’);//Whatever bitmap is
while (C <= 100) do
begin
C := C + 5;
if (FindBitMapToleranceIn(Bitmap, TX, TY, 673, 28, 713, 72, C)) then
begin
Color := GetColor(TX, TY);
Result := Color;
Break;
end;
end;
WriteLn('Color = ’ + IntToStr(Color))
if (Result = 0) then
WriteLn(‘Error: Color NOT Found’);
FreeBitMap(Bitmap);
end;

begin
BlahBlah := FindBlahBlah;
if(FindColorSpiral(x, y, BlahBlah, 0, 0, 1000, 1000)) then
begin
//Whatever you want it to do
end;
end.[/scar]

Hope this helped,
Mad Cow

Read full topic

item.title: Auto color picking?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Taios:

A good way of doing it is by using dtms. Make it find a dtm containing the color you want, then save the color it finds there

Colors change every loading screen.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto color picking?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

function Getcolor(x, y: Integer): integer;

Returns the color found at the given co-ordinates. For finding ore, You could either use find color and raise the tolerance until it finds a base colour of that ore; Then use getcolor and grab the color it found. 

  if (FindColorTolerance([b]x, y[/b], 255, 0, 0, 50, 50, 20)) then
  begin
    NewColor:= Getcolor([b]x, y[/b]);
  end;

If it finds a color relevent to 255 then it will use get color to grab that color.

Read full topic
